info.title: Atlas
info.description:
Getting started with the Atlas API:
- Log in with `/v1/sessions/login` using your provided credentials. Click `Authorize` below and enter the returned token.
- (Optional) Create an `BUILDER` role API key with `/v1/sessions/keys`. Re-authorize using the returned token.

Publish and verify data points:
- Create a device with `/v1/devices`. Include a notable `tag` for future use.
- Publish data with `/v1/datapoints`. The `attr` and `val` fields can be arbitrarily chosen.
- Inspect the received data with `/v1/datapoints/latest` using the device's `uniqID`.

Publish data points and receive alerts:
- Update your user with `/v1/users/{user.id}` to include a notable `tag`.
- Create a rule with `/v1/rules`. The `deviceTag` field should match a tag of the device. The `expr` field can be simply `true`.
- Create an alarm with `/v1/rules/{alarm.ruleID}/alarms`. The `type` field should match data that is available in the user's fields, such as `EMAIL`. The `userTags` field should include a tag of the user.
- Publish data for the device, as done in the previous section. The `attr` field should match the `attr` of the rule.
- Verify the alert is received by the user on the configured `type` method.
- Inspect the created event with `/v1/events` using the device's `uniqID`.
- Inspect the created alert with `/v1/alerts` using the device's `uniqID`.

get.summary: List all alerts for a device, alarm, and/or user in an [end, start) time range, in descending timestamp order. Alerts are generated by alarms via parent rules.

parameters.name: uniqID
parameters.description: Device unique ID. If neither unique ID nor device ID are specified, all devices are included.

parameters.name: deviceID
parameters.description: Device ID (UUID). If neither unique ID nor device ID are specified, all devices are included.

parameters.name: alarmID
parameters.description: Alarm ID (UUID). If not specified, all alarms are included.

parameters.name: userID
parameters.description: User ID (UUID). If not specified, all users are included.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: Alerts range end time. Defaults to current time if not specified. Maximum supported time range is 90 days.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: Alerts range start time. Defaults to end_time - 24 hours if not specified or after end_time. Maximum supported time range is 90 days.

get.summary: List all data points for a device in an [end, start) time range, in descending timestamp order. Data points are generated by devices.

parameters.name: uniqID
parameters.description: Device unique ID. Either unique ID or device ID must be provided.

parameters.name: deviceID
parameters.description: Device ID (UUID). Either unique ID or device ID must be provided.

parameters.name: attr
parameters.description: Device attribute. If not specified, all attributes are included.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: Data points range end time. Defaults to current time if not specified. Maximum supported time range is 90 days.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: Data points range start time. Defaults to end_time - 24 hours if not specified or after end_time. Maximum supported time range is 90 days.

post.summary: Publish data points via the API. Data points are generated by devices.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: PublishDataPointsRequest is sent to publish data points. The publisher role is recommended for programmatic use of this endpoint.

get.summary: List the latest data point for each of a device's attributes in a [now, start) time range. Data points are generated by devices.

parameters.name: uniqID
parameters.description: Device unique ID. Either unique ID or device ID must be provided.

parameters.name: deviceID
parameters.description: Device ID (UUID). Either unique ID or device ID must be provided.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: Data points range start time. Defaults to now - 30 days if not specified. Maximum supported time range is 90 days.

get.summary: List all devices. Devices generate data points.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of devices to retrieve in a single page. Defaults to 50 if not specified, with a maximum of 250.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: Token of the page to retrieve. If not specified, the first page of results will be returned. To request the next page of results, use next_page_token from the previous response.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Device tag. If not specified, all tags are included.

post.summary: Create a device. Devices generate data points.

parameters.name: device
parameters.description: Device message to create.

put.summary: Update a device. Devices generate data points.

parameters.name: device.id
parameters.description: Device ID (UUID).

parameters.name: device
parameters.description: Device message to update.

token.description: Authentication token (UUID). Will be generated at creation time, but can be updated afterward.

tags.description: Device tags. Nested tags should be delimited by '/'.

parameters.name: updateMask
parameters.description: Fields to update. Automatically populated by a PATCH request. If not present, a full resource update is performed.

patch.summary: Update a device. Devices generate data points.

parameters.name: device.id
parameters.description: Device ID (UUID).

parameters.name: device
parameters.description: Device message to update.

token.description: Authentication token (UUID). Will be generated at creation time, but can be updated afterward.

tags.description: Device tags. Nested tags should be delimited by '/'.

get.summary: List all events for a device in an [end, start) time range, in descending timestamp order. Events are generated by rules when conditions are met.

parameters.name: uniqID
parameters.description: Device unique ID. Either unique ID or device ID must be provided.

parameters.name: deviceID

parameters.name: ruleID

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: Events range end time. Defaults to current time if not specified. Maximum supported time range is 90 days.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: Events range start time. Defaults to end_time - 24 hours if not specified or after end_time. Maximum supported time range is 90 days.

get.summary: List the latest event for each of an organization's devices. Events are generated by rules when conditions are met.

parameters.name: ruleID
parameters.description: Rule ID (UUID). If not specified, all rules are included.

get.summary: List all organizations. An organization is the top level resource and contains users, devices, rules, and derived resources.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of organizations to retrieve in a single page. Defaults to 50 if not specified, with a maximum of 250.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: Token of the page to retrieve. If not specified, the first page of results will be returned. To request the next page of results, use next_page_token from the previous response.

tags.description: User tags. Nested tags should be delimited by '/'.

userTags.description: User tags to whom alerts are sent.

subjectTemplate.description: Alarm subject template. Templates generate HTML-safe output using the [Go template engine](https://golang.org/pkg/html/template/).

bodyTemplate.description: Alarm body template. Templates generate HTML-safe output using the [Go template engine](https://golang.org/pkg/html/template/).

repeatInterval.description: Alarm repeat interval, in minutes, per device. Duration after which a duplicate event will cause an alert to be sent. Minimum is 1 minute, maximum is 14 days.

Alarm.description: Alarm represents an alarm as stored in the database.

AlarmType.description:
AlarmType represents the type of an alarm.

 - ALARM_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Alarm type is not specified.
 - APP: Push notification via mobile application.
 - SMS: SMS notification.
 - EMAIL: Email notification.

error.description: Error message. This field will be empty if no error was encountered.

Alert.description: Alert represents an alert as stored in the database.

AlertStatus.description:
AlertStatus represents the status of an alert.

 - ALERT_STATUS_UNSPECIFIED: Alert status is not specified.
 - SENT: Alert was successfully sent.
 - ERROR: Alert encountered an error.

CreateDeviceLoRaWANBody.description: CreateDeviceLoRaWANRequest is sent to add LoRaWAN configuration to a device.

token.description: Token to be used for subsequent calls. Only returned once, upon key creation.

CreateKeyResponse.description: CreateKeyResponse is sent in response to an API key creation.

uniqID.description: Device unique ID. Ignored during MQTT ingest if provided as part of the topic. Required for API publish.

bytesVal.description: Bytes value. When used in JSON, the value will be represented as a base64 string.

ts.description: Timestamp. If not present during MQTT ingest or API publish, the current time will be used.

token.description: Authentication token (UUID). Only used during MQTT ingest. Will be ignored if provided as part of the Payload message.

traceId.description: Trace ID (UUID). Assigned by the platform, will be ignored if provided during MQTT ingest or API publish.

DataPoint.description: DataPoint represents a data point as stored in the database.

Decoder.description:
Decoder represents the data payload decoder for a device.

 - RAW: Payloads will be passed through without decoding. Appropriate for devices that do not use decoders (MQTT, API, etc.).
 - GATEWAY: LoRaWAN gateway. Acts as a pass-through in the absence of device data payloads.
 - RADIO_BRIDGE_DOOR_V1: Radio Bridge Door/Window sensor with V1 firmware.
 - RADIO_BRIDGE_DOOR_V2: Radio Bridge Door/Window sensor with V2 firmware.
 - GLOBALSAT_CO2: GlobalSat LS-111P CO2 sensor.
 - GLOBALSAT_CO: GlobalSat LS-112P CO sensor.
 - GLOBALSAT_PM25: GlobalSat LS-113P PM2.5 sensor.
 - TEKTELIC_HOME: TEKTELIC Kona All-in-One Home Sensor.

token.description: Authentication token (UUID). Will be generated at creation time, but can be updated afterward.

tags.description: Device tags. Nested tags should be delimited by '/'.

Device.description: Device represents a device as stored in the database.

DeviceLoRaWANType.description: DeviceLoRaWANType is sent to add LoRaWAN device configuration.

Event.description: Event represents an event as stored in the database.

GatewayLoRaWANType.description: GatewayLoRaWANType is sent to add LoRaWAN gateway configuration.

Key.description: Key represents an API key as stored in the database. API keys are not tied to a specific user.

points.description: Data point array, ordered by ascending attribute name.

LatestDataPointsResponse.description: LatestDataPointsResponse is sent in response to a device latest list.

events.description: Event array, ordered by descending created_at timestamp.

LatestEventsResponse.description: LatestEventsResponse is sent in response to an organization latest list.

alarms.description: Alarm array, ordered by ascending created_at timestamp.

nextPageToken.description: Pagination token used to retrieve the next page of results. Not returned for the last page.

ListAlarmsResponse.description: ListAlarmsResponse is sent in response to an alarm list.

alerts.description: Alert array, ordered by descending created_at timestamp.

ListAlertsResponse.description: ListAlertsResponse is sent in response to a device alerts list.

points.description: Data point array, ordered by descending created_at timestamp.

ListDataPointsResponse.description: ListDataPointsResponse is sent in response to a device data points list.

devices.description: Device array, ordered by ascending created_at timestamp.

nextPageToken.description: Pagination token used to retrieve the next page of results. Not returned for the last page.

ListDevicesResponse.description: ListDevicesResponse is sent in response to a device list.

events.description: Event array, ordered by descending created_at timestamp.

ListEventsResponse.description: ListEventsResponse is sent in response to a device events list.

keys.description: Key array, ordered by ascending created_at timestamp.

nextPageToken.description: Pagination token used to retrieve the next page of results. Not returned for the last page.

totalSize.description: Total number of API keys available.

ListKeysResponse.description: ListKeysResponse is sent in response to an API key list.

orgs.description: Org array, ordered by ascending created_at timestamp.

nextPageToken.description: Pagination token used to retrieve the next page of results. Not returned for the last page.

ListOrgsResponse.description: ListOrgsResponse is sent in response to an organization list.

rules.description: Rule array, ordered by ascending created_at timestamp.

nextPageToken.description: Pagination token used to retrieve the next page of results. Not returned for the last page.

ListRulesResponse.description: ListRulesResponse is sent in response to a rule list.

tags.description: Tag array, ordered by ascending name.

ListTagsResponse.description: ListTagsResponse is sent in response to a tag list.

users.description: User array, ordered by ascending created_at timestamp. The completeness of the array will depend on whether the request was made by an admin user, non-admin user, or API key.

nextPageToken.description: Pagination token used to retrieve the next page of results. Not returned for the last page.

ListUsersResponse.description: ListUsersResponse is sent in response to a user list.

email.description: Email of the user to log in.

orgName.description: Organization name of the user to log in.

password.description: Password of the user to log in.

LoginRequest.description: LoginRequest is sent to log in a user.

token.description: Token to be used for subsequent non-login calls.

LoginResponse.description: LoginResponse is sent in response to a user login.

displayName.description: Organization display name. Used anywhere the organization is shown to a user, including web sites and alert sender fields.

email.description: Organization email. Used as the 'From' address in email alerts.

Org.description: Org represents an organization as stored in the database.

PublishDataPointsRequest.description: PublishDataPointsRequest is sent to publish data points. The publisher role is recommended for programmatic use of this endpoint.

Role.description:
Role represents the role of a user.

 - ROLE_UNSPECIFIED: Role is not specified.
 - CONTACT: Contacts are not allowed to log in to the system, but can receive and respond to alerts from their organization.
 - VIEWER: Viewers can only read resources in their organization, but can update their own user.
 - PUBLISHER: Publishers can publish data points, but otherwise can only read resources in their organization.
 - BUILDER: Builders can read and modify resources in their organization, but can only update their own user.
 - ADMIN: Admins can read and modify anything in their organization, including creating users of an equal or lesser role.
 - SYS_ADMIN: System admins can create organizations and modify anything in their organization.

deviceTag.description: Device tag to which the rule applies.

attr.description: Data point attribute to which the rule applies.

expr.description: Rule expression. The rules engine evaluates a boolean expression using the [Expr language](https://expr-lang.org/).

Rule.description: Rule represents a rule as stored in the database.

point.description: Data point to test against an alarm.

rule.description: Rule to test against an alarm.

device.description: Device to test against an alarm.

TestAlarmRequest.description: TestAlarmRequest is sent to test an alarm.

result.description: Result of the alarm generation. Subjects and bodies will be concatenated with ' - '.

TestAlarmResponse.description: TestAlarmResponse is sent in response to an alarm test.

point.description: Data point to test against a rule.

TestRuleRequest.description: TestRuleRequest is sent to test a rule.

TestRuleResponse.description: TestRuleResponse is sent in response to a rule test.

UpdateUserPasswordBody.description: UpdateUserPasswordRequest is sent to update a user's password.

phone.description: User phone number. If specified, must be in valid [E.164](https://www.twilio.com/docs/glossary/what-e164) format.

tags.description: User tags. Nested tags should be delimited by '/'.

User.description: User represents a user as stored in the database.

api.Status.description:
Status represents the status of a message.

 - STATUS_UNSPECIFIED: Status is not specified.
 - ACTIVE: Message subject is active.
 - DISABLED: Message subject is disabled.

TokenAuth.description: Enter your token (/v1/sessions/login) in the format **Bearer <token>**
TokenAuth.name: Authorization

externalDocs.description: Protobuf + gRPC definitions and example code
